document_title: Ovarian cysts: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Doctor Ho Thi Khanh Quyen said that the diagnosis of ovarian cysts always combines clinical and paraclinical examination to have the most accurate diagnosis, avoiding missing small signs that affect the results.
Clinical diagnosis
Doctors can exploit some patient information as a basis for diagnosis such as:
Menstrual cycle disorders;; Symptoms of pain and discomfort in the pelvic area;; Pain during sex;; Difficulty urinating, urinary retention, constipation.
Check for symptoms of pain in the lower abdomen and pelvis
Paraclinical diagnosis
Paraclinical diagnostic methods include:
Ultrasound: This is a non-invasive, low-cost imaging method that can reveal the tumor location, shape, size, and internal properties of the tumor. Ultrasound images can suggest benign or malignant tumors; CT scan or MRI: If a large tumor is suspected, an MRI scan helps see ultrasound results more clearly, while CT scan results support accurate diagnosis of tumor spread or metastasis.; Testing for tumor markers can suggest tumor malignancy such as: CA 125, AFP, beta HCG, HE4...
